intro: Campanula sibirica subsp. sibirica, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the colder regions of Asia. It features upright stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a hardy choice for gardens in temperate climates. Its showy blooms attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
